review_blob:
Weak kind of empty taste. Not what a Pilsner should be....Too much hops for this style. Hops would be OK with an IPA or something else but not here.
Wouldnt buy again. Not even a good hot day beer.

Best brown Ive had. Got it at 16 days old 12oz can. Bought it because I feel you cant go wrong with cigar City. Correct. These guys get just about everything right. Dark brown almost porter color pour. Cocoa, toasted nuts, espresso...lots going on for a brown ale. Not too complex though. You could session this beer since its low on carbonation and high on taste AND...thank goodness, NOT another IPA which is so played out that its embarrassing.
I live 5 miles from the brewery and at almost nine bucks for a sixer I felt Id give it a go. Shoulda saved 3 and bought some Bud

Been drinking Anchor Porter all winter and loving its almost Trappist notes. Decided to give this a go and was disappointed. Tastes like some type of candy and I couldnt figure it out. It finally hit me. Bubs Daddy Grape Bubblegum only not as good. Not really impressed by this klinker and will pass in the future.
Looks like Porter smells like a chocolate phosphate but was pretty empty on feel. I didnt get any chewiness or depth. I have a sixer to decide. aint no Anchor or Founders though.

A bunch of strange tastes but not ones that seem to go together. Like banana and metal or funky murk and fizzy candy. Weird stuff. Wouldnt turn one down at a block party but wouldnt spend the money to buy again.

Oops. saw the word Guinness and thought, well if they put their name on it it must be ok. NOPE. Shoulda bought the Bud and save a buck fifty. I guess its not too bad. kinda ok if you pretend like this is what American Lagers used to taste like. Good for Kegger party ice buckets and lawn mowing.

Bomber poured black with a big beige head that dissipates quickly. Very drinkable coffee toffee caramel hints but not sweet. Best part is if you nurse it and let it warm , the last bit has an almost scotch/peaty smoke taste to it. Very nice autumn beer....Just like all the brewerys selections.

growler from Craft Beer Factory Marietta. Probably should have poured earlier then I did but I like this. Not so much an IPA but more ESB. Caramel malty goodness in an IPA. I detected not a lot of hops that normally identify a IPA. I had a Terrapin high 5 before this and it seems not IPAish at all. Id by again.

Like all highly rated and high dollar IPAs, this one is good. Nice color and thin compact head. Aroma is pear banana melon etc. Citrus punch but with a kind of buttery hit. Good stuff. I wish I could get to the brewery and try all CCs beers
beer_name: Cigar City Jai Alai India Pale Ale

review_blob: Aroma of tropical fruits and melon. Piney and a bitter bomb at first. Hop bitters mellow as you go on. I prefer Terrapin high 5 or Two Heart esp at 12-13 bucks a sixer.
Finally a IPA thats good that doesnt run 10+ bucks a sixer. Nice fruity aroma with piney hops(not blatant) really pretty good with summer food esp spicy dishes and fish.

Interesting blast of bitterness out of the bomber. Then....as if by magic it disappears. Then its enjoyable and I could imagine ordering another if I were at a bar. Cool deep copper color nice head thats thin but hangs right in there. Not too shabby...Probably great with grilled meats,would buy again.

I like to drink a new beer and guess what RB will have it ranked. I proclaimed this is an 80. Ran to the PC and discovered 90. As I worked through the 6 pack I discovered a nice funky finish to this beer. Nice and malty with a bit of hop. Quite a departure from all the IPAs out there. Man, am I sick of those. Would certainly buy again. 7.99 was a deal

Forget the pour and head and appearance. This product must be experienced if you even think that you are some kind of beer connoisseur.
Imagine all the great buttery breads and candies and dark fruits in Europe.
Put em together and imbibe. Truly something to behold. From Licorice and raisins to plums and walnut sweetbread. From Twizzlers and toasted nuts to bananas and apricot. The more you drink and think the more different combos and nuances you can come up with. A thing you must do. Wonderful and satisfying.

Pours tobacco juice brown...dark. Pretty. Very little head and no lace to speak of. Toasted malts and espresso. Very nice saddle leather tack shop type taste on the palate. Bought April 15 with cold spell arriving. More carbonation than expected. Nice treat

Bought this at Kroger from some marketing chick with long legs and big tits....sucker for a pretty face. She gave me two glasses with it too. Laser etched cat in the bottom to increase effervescence which it actually does. .This shit tastes like soap. I feel embarrassed and ashamed.

This is what i think the beer that people drink in B&W; movies taste like. Like the beer you snuck from the ole mans cooler when you were a kid. Same stuff. You knew it was supposed to taste good but you hadnt developed a palate for it. i like lagers ok and this one beats the so called premiums quite handily. Not bad..Not as thin as the big boys and certainly more grain taste. Malt and hops are quite pale. Another good yard work brew.
beer_name: Anchor Zymaster Series No. 1 California Lager

review_blob: Not bad swillin brew. Very grapefruity taste and fruit aroma. Like the islands...Mango guava maybe a little pineapple. Hops are not too strong. Hardly any malt . A bit watery but not bad on a hot day working in the yard type stuff.

Nice...always wanted to try this Trappist. Opened up while cold and got pure bubblegum from the tulip. after letting it warm a bit the flavors got so complex as to not even be able to pinpoint. Almonds, banana, rock candy, sweet bread. Alcohol was not overwhelming. Good malt. Still trying to figure out that initial taste. Not a lot of funk. Would for sure drink again but its 50 cents more than StBerardus Abt12 which rules the roost IMHO. Buy and enjoy.

Smelling while still in the bottle blasts flowers and pineapple and melon. In the glass was nicely clouded and aroma was more floral and complex. Tasted sublime for a style thats been played to death. Hops were there but not "punch you in the face" bitter as most IPAs are. Really outstanding....pricey but worth it. Highly recommended.

I bought 2 bottles of this at 4.99 per thinking I could get more beer (Belgian abbey) for the buck. The 1st bottle was the funkiest wasabi spiked garbage Ive had in a while. I was going to trash the brew masters reputation thoroughly. I opened the second bottle today and it was quite different. Still that indescribable wasabi-sour funk but not as prevalent.  Appearance and pour are nice but that sour weirdness is a bit disconcerting.  Now as it warms a bit the wasabi spike has diminished and its more of a sour apple. Im going to the store now get a couple St Bernardus Abt12s

Caramel. fruit...fig, raisin,date maybe...Good. at 7 bucks. A steal actually. Super for a Trappist style Dubbel from the good ole USA. Nice pour and head and color. a little metallic on the nose but I drank it from a Burgundy glass. Recommended.

A nice quad. Very typical of the Trappist method. A little too carbonated for me but all the usual attributes of the type. Its no Rochefort 10 or St Bernardus but its as close as an American brewery can get. Would buy again.

Ive  given up trying to find the jewel of cheap garbage that brewerys label as "Belgian". Thinking maybe this might be a watered down saison and finding myself wrong again. Unfortunately I have 5 more of these strawberry soda colored turds to fight through before I go get a nice 750ml REAL Belgian of some sort.
beer_name: Blue Moon Short Straw Farmhouse Red Ale

review_blob: Floral peachy and piney weak aroma. Typical pour and appearance. Taste like bitter stainless steel. weird stuff. Probably good for a upper middle class grad party. Do they still drink at grad parties?

i picked this up in a boxed 6 pack. when I was rung up the cashier said "$3.17"...I said are you sure and he said its on clearance. I said whats wrong with it and he replied nothing. Its best by date was 12/31/12 and this is Feb 13. I figured Marzens had been kept over the summer originally so I took it home.Alas ...Not very good.

I like to get a beer ...taste it and then rate it and compare to rate beer. I was dead on with this one. Nice color, flimsy head, watered down taste with no palate or body whatsoever. Aroma was mostly coffee and taste was strangely wasabi-like.  Wouldnt buy again but would probably drink one if offered. I did however enjoy the side of the box that gave the aroma, color and taste dynamics in visual form. Unfortunately I was fooled.

Brownies and coffee. First sip out seemed watered and young. I say young simply because of a lack of depth. Initial aroma out of the bottle was a bit funky like some cut weeds or grass in a place youve never been. Foreign type of smell. All and all not too bad. You could put a few away.

Needed a pale to go with some curry I got to go. Bottle. Not a big fan of the hop bombs so I figured Id give this a go. Nice lace and an unclear gold. Not copper at all. lots of floral and a mellow grapefruit overtone. Hints of almonds or something but as I delved in became more like a cedar. Not to shabby. Would buy again.
Opened the bottle and was overwhelmed with pineapple...nice and clean. A little grapefruit and smooth. Tons better than the Sam Adams IPA I bought earlier.

Bottle. Initial aroma was hoppy raspberrys.
Interesting and complex for an IPA. Pour was amber and head was a bit weak. At first taste it seemed a little boozy but was followed by another shortly thereafter. a little on the sweet side but drinkable for sure.
